reforms.name: Data example for the new website

not_started.description: The Industrial Disputes Act sets a floor of 100 employees after which government permission is required to lay off workers

incomplete.description: The parliament on September 23, 2020 passed the Industrial Relations Code, 2019 giving firms with upto 300 employees flexibility in hiring and firing.

completed.description: An amendment or new law removes the cap entirely, giving firms of all sizes flexibility in hiring and firing.

reforms.name: Allow companies to conduct layoffs without government permission
